column4: how do I get out of the gui? I tried /etc/init.d/gdm stop and it didnt seem to affect anything...
ctrl+alt+f1 will take you to a terminal
yes - I am a gentoo user
im trying out the new ubuntu - I seem to have run into a pretty serious issue - I remember this used to be easy but gnome is rather stubborn
right, so what is the problem then, and sudo /etc/init.d/gdm stop (from a console, not an xterm) should be enough to stop gdm
